column4: I'm having trouble booting. unreadable text displays and stops before gui is up. any ideas?
I'm having trouble booting. unreadable text displays and stops boot process before gui is up. any ideas?
I'm having trouble booting. unreadable text displays and stops before gui is up. any ideas?
wait more then 2 minutes between repeating your question
ratcheer it would be whatever is standard install... I'll try it.
you'd first need to chroot into your HD install (see !grub2 for info on that) then use apt-get to uninstall it.
thanks!
about the grub2 topic... how do I get to that info?
the link provided there has the steps for chrooting into you HD install
Hey, thanks :)
1) what graphics card 2) how did you install them?
stock nvidia on Dell Demension 8300 and through ubuntu update manager.
apt-cache policy nvidia-current does it show installed?
nvidia-current:   Installed: (none)   Candidate: 270.41.06-0ubuntu1   Version table:      270.41.06-0ubuntu1 0         500 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ natty/restricted i386 Packages
so nvidia-current is not installed, do you see the Installed: (none).  I'm not sure what version you need though.  "lspci | grep -i vga" will give card model.
output: "01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV34 [GeForce FX 5200] (rev a1)"

from my very brief search, looks like you need the nvidia 173 driver.  I've never had much luck with the non-current nvidia stuff, so hopefully if you run into issues someone else can help.  I'd also suggest you do an internet search to see if you can confirm/deny that 173 is the correct version.
Awesome! Thanks! How should I word that so apt-get install will fetch that for me?
i'm unable to verify, but "sudo apt-get install nvidia-<TAB>" should list the options.
Ok. Thanks for all the help!!
glad to help, good luck!
nvidia-173 did the trick. now to reboot to find out if it worked!
if it's USB, you might want to unplug it (wait a couple of seconds) plug it back in and in a terminal run "dmesg | tail -25" to find more info on the device.
oh, ndiswrapper... sorry, AP gave you the info already.
